concept.title: Change Rectifier Charge Mode

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Explains how to change the rectifier charging mode using the charging control menu and describes how the UPS responds to mode changes such as float, boost, or equalization.

othermeta.name: entities
othermeta.content: rectifier module; battery charger; battery bank; system display; charging control menu; charging mode controller

othermeta.name: tags
othermeta.content: charging mode, rectifier, float charge, boost charge, equalization, battery maintenance

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: guide operators in modifying the ups rectifier charging mode according to battery maintenance requirements

conbody.p: By default the rectifier is in float charge. The system can automatically switch to boost charge to increase the battery charge voltage when needed.
It is also possible to manually change to boost charge or equalizing charge.
conbody.note: It is possible to inhibit boost charge and/or equalizing charge. If boost or equalizing charge is inhibited, the rectifier cannot automatically or to manually change to the inhibited charge modes. The charge modes can be blocked permanently or by an external signal.
